column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Dexus' Lead @ Dexus is a program designed to instil self-awareness, motivation and strategies required for its people to improve their leadership skills. In FY23, Dexus progressed its commitment to roll out the program to all people managers and new and emerging leaders, with 54% of people managers participating as of 30 June 2023.

column6: Programs for upgrading employee skills and transition assistance programs
column13: Dexus extended its internal learning program to include Grow @ Dexus, which provides inclusive development opportunities for all employees. On 30 June 2023, 43% of employees have attended the program. The program was launched following feedback received in regular engagement surveys and has included topics related to sustainability and ESG megatrends, personal branding and executive presence.
column20: Grow @ Dexus, internal learning program, engagement survey

column6: Percentage of employees receiving regular performance and career development reviews
column13: Dexus participates in the Property Council of Australia's Girls in Property Program. This industry partnership program aims to raise awareness among high school students of the various career paths available across the property industry, ultimately encouraging greater female participation.
column20: Girls in Property, awareness, female participation

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Dexus' Future Leaders in Property program provides young women with exposure to the property industry, including the chance to experience a live build and see how it impacts the community. The program provides students a unique opportunity to gain industry knowledge while empowering women to confidently make study and career decisions.
column20: Future Leaders in Property, young woman, career decision

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Dexus' LGBTQ+ employee network, TRIBE, raised awareness and celebrated LGBTQ+ inclusion across its workforce and customer community while working on initiatives including gender-neutral bathrooms.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: Through the partnership with PiD, Dexus sponsored the development of an eLearning module called Foundations of LGBTQ+ Inclusion. In February, the module was launched to all employees and accompanied by a donation drive for Wear it Purple, with $8,000 donated as of 30 June 2023.
column20: PiD, Foundations of LGBTQ+ Inclusion, donation drive

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column7: Dexus' gender pay ratio in executive management positions is 0.9:1.

column6: Incidents of discrimination and corrective actions taken
column13: Dexus continued to build awareness and understanding across employees. The cultural awareness training was designed in partnership with PwC Indigenous Consulting Pty Limited, with 89% of employees participating as of 30 June 2023.
column20: Cultural awareness training, understanding, PwC Indigenous Consulting

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column13: Dexus held an all-employee webinar hosted by the Dexus RAP Working Group, where Dexus Directors Penny Bingham-Hall and Nicola Roxon answered questions concerning Indigenous awareness. They were joined by a trusted advisor from PwC Indigenous Consulting Pty Ltd to reflect on the referendum and its potential impacts.
column20: Dexus RAP Working Group, Indigenous awareness, PwC Indigenous Consulting

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column13: In 2023, Dexus continues to deliver against its Reflect Reconciliation Action Plan (RAP), which reinforces Dexus's commitment to promoting acknowledgement, respect, and reconciliation with Australia's First Nations peoples. Reconciliation Australia endorses Dexus's RAP and marks the beginning of Dexus's reconciliation journey.
column20: Reflect Reconciliation Action Plan, First Nations, reconciliation journey

column4: Freedom of Association and Collective Bargaining
column6: Operations and suppliers in which the right to freedom of association and collective bargaining may be at risk
column13: Dexus took opportunities to raise awareness of the referendum during National Reconciliation Week. Aligning with this year's theme of 'Be a Voice for Generations', Dexus celebrated National Reconciliation Week through shared information and learning opportunities, encouraging employee engagement to Listen, Act and Learn about the upcoming referendum.
column20: National Reconciliation Week, awareness, employee engagement

column13: This year's theme, 'For our Elders' for NAIDOC Week, recognised the prominent place Elders continue to hold in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities and families. NAIDOC Week was celebrated across Dexus' properties through various customer activations. At Indooroopilly Shopping Centre, local Indigenous artist Matt Robert was commissioned to create the artwork Ngalin Ayeye (Our Yarn), narrating the connection of the lands on the shopping centre site and surrounding areas to the local Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.
column20: NAIDOC Week, Indigenous artist, shopping centre

column13: Dexus has an Anti-Modern Slavery Working Group responsible for coordinating the group's approach to identifying, assessing, and addressing modern slavery risk in Dexus operations and supply chain.

column13: Dexus aims to have the most efficient systems and processes, including financial accounting and operational systems. Regular reviews of policies and procedures on information security are undertaken. Dexus has comprehensive Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery plans, which are tested annually.
column20: Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery, operational system, information security

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Regular training, testing and disaster recovery activities are conducted, along with the employment of data security software, to assist in reducing the risk of threats or breaches to data. Dexus also educates and trains its people on protecting their data.
column20: Disaster recovery, data security, breach of data

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: Additional reviews have been undertaken in response to the increased frequency and nature of cyber-attacks experienced across the broader Australian corporate landscape. Mitigation strategies are in place to address potential cyber security threats to, or via, Dexus' assets.
